flawed_nl_solution:
Tom can buy 1000/2=<<1000/2=500>>500 for half price.
He will spend $0.5/2= $<<0.5/2=0.25>>0.25 on the half-priced bricks.
Thus, he will spend 500*$0.25=${500*0.25=125} on the half-priced bricks.
He will spend 500*$0.5=${500*0.5=250} on the full-priced bricks.
Thus, he will spend $125+$250=${125+250=357} total.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 375.0, not 357.0. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
